msDesc.head: Canon law; A-D Germany (mostly Leipzig), 15th century, first half (mostly 1421)

supportDesc.extent: ii (paper) + 1 (parchment, former pastedown) + 274 + 1 (paper, repaired, = fol. 274) + ii folios (132 is double) 304 215

binding.p: 15th-century binding of blind-ruled and stampted leather over boards, rebacked. Tabs. The stamps are rosette of six leaves (Einbanddatenbank m002438); rosette of four leaves.

history.provenance: Dated on fols. 46, 69v, 76v, 101, 126v, 165, 261; the undated sections are contemporary except for short texts added later in the fifteenth century. Fols. 262–274 not dated, but the watermark is compatible with a date of c. 1421 or perhaps a little later.
Erfurt, Carthusian abbey: identifiable as A23(2) in the late-fifteenth-century catalogue (ed. P. Lehmann, pp. 253–4).
Friedrich Gottlieb Julius von Bülow, 1760-?1831, probably identifiable as 234 in the catalogue of part 3 of his sale, 10 Oct. 1836.
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian Library by his sons and received in 1857.

recordHist.source: Description adapted by Matthew Holford (Sept. 2020), with additional description of content, layout, decoration, binding, and provenance, from A. G. Watson, Catalogue of dated and datable manuscripts c. 435–1600 in Oxford libraries (1984), no. 505. Previously described in the Summary Catalogue. Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 30

listBibl.head: Online resources:

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.bibl: Balázs József Nemes, Bibliotheca Cartusiae Erfordiensis : Dokumentation über den überlieferten Buchbestand der Erfurter Kartause, 3., korrigierte und erweiterte Version (2022) DOI: 10.6094/UNIFR/223370

title.supplied: Summaria capitulorum seu Casus summarii Decretalium Gregorii IX

msItem.note: Here attributed to an unidentified 'Bernardus' or 'Bernardus graecus' (not the work of Bernard of Compostella or Bernard of Parma). For apparently similar texts see J. Fliege, Die Handschriften der ehemaligen Stifts- und Gymnasialbibliothek Quedlinburg in Halle. (1982), 234, on Qu. Cod. 131, fols. 121r-156v (on Liber extra books 1–2 only); S. Heyne, Die mittelalterlichen Codices Erfordenses in der Universitäts- und Forschungsbibliothek Erfurt / Gotha (2005) 61–2, on CE 8o 22, fols. 1r-132v (similar only in Liber extra bks. 1–2); and more generally Schulte II.492–4.

msItem.rubric: Rubrica de Summa Trinitate et Fide Catholica [later hand]
msItem.incipit: Firmiter credimus Simpliciter credendum est quod vnus solus et verus deus eternus
(fol. 1rb) Damnamus Casus licet quis erret in fide non debet hereticus censeri dum tamen fidem romane ecclesie paratus sit suscipere uel se illa tenere fatetur
(fol. 1rb) De constitucionibus. Canonum Postquam deus formauit hominem ad ymaginem et similitudinem eius Ius naturale cum ipso prodiit
msItem.explicit: Compromissum non extenditur in conpromittentes heredes si de ipsis non caueatur ibidem etc.

msItem.incipit: De quo uult deo Casus. Qui promisit iudicem suum non declinare
Decreuimus Casus. Laycus ecclesiatica negocia tractare non debet
msItem.explicit: Item papa per constituciones non intendit viribus episcoporum preiudiciam
msItem.colophon: Tunc est finis 14201421 In die marcelli
msItem.finalRubric: Et est finis huius secundi libri decretalium

msItem.rubric: De vite et honestate clericorum III
msItem.incipit: Et layci Casus. Quando sacra celebrantur in ecclesia clerici stare debent in choro et layci in parte maiori ecclesie
msItem.explicit: Item litterati in theologia debent esse bellatores pro fide katholica contra impugnatores etc.
msItem.colophon: Finis huius 3ij anno MCCCCxxj ipso die Brigide virginis

msItem.rubric: De sponsalibus et matrimoniis IIII liber
msItem.incipit: De Francia Nota sponsalia sunt futurarum nupciarum promissio dicta a spondendo id est promittendo
Preterea Casus. Soluuntur sponsalia de futuro si sponsi se ab inuicem absoluunt
msItem.colophon: est finis anno MCCCCo xxj in die sancti blasij hora septima de mane
msItem.finalRubric: Etc finis huius quarti sequitur quintus

msItem.rubric: V De accusacionibus et inquisicionibus et denunciacionibus
msItem.incipit: Si legittimus Accusacio est criminis alicuius apud iudicem competentem facta
Denuncciacio Casus. Criminis alicuius apud iudicem competentem non inscripcione
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt casus libri decretalium compilacionis greci bernhardi
msItem.colophon: Anno MCCCCo xxj ipso die sancti valentini in lypcz.

title.supplied: Summaria capitulorum seu Casus summarii Libri sexti decretalium

msItem.incipit: Bonifacius episcopus Prohemium illud in quattuor diuiditur partes. In prima ponitur salutacio
Episcopus Hoc est verbum ante consecracionem et coronacionem, Seruus seruorum dei, non simpliciter dicit se seruum sed seruum dei, quasi de hiis que sunt foris
(fols. 102rb) Fideli Errore grecorum qui dicebant spiritum sanctum procedere a solo patre extirpato per canones
msItem.explicit: Sicut si conceditur episcopo ut possit beneficia suorum clericorum cedencium vel decedencium conferre tunc sub clericorum solum ipsius domestici et familiares intelligitur
msItem.note: For the ending cf. Augsburg UB Cod. II. 1. 4o 71 art. 5 (also followed by Regulae iuris); elsewhere seems to be abbreviated from Johannes Andreae, Apparatus ad Sextum

msItem.author: Boniface VIII
msItem.title: Liber sextus: De regulis iuris
msItem.incipit: Beneficium ecclesiasticum non potest licite
msItem.explicit: Datum Rome aput sanctum petrum v nonarum marcii pontificatus nostri anno 4o.
msItem.note: The text only.
A later hand adds notes from the Stella clericorum, the Speculum exemplorum attributed to Johannes Busch, and the Revelations of St Bridget.

msItem.title: Epistola Luciferi
msItem.rubric: Epistola Sathane missa ex centro inferni vniuersis principibus mundi maxime moderne ecclesie qui eius imperio et voluntati famulantur [later hand]
msItem.incipit: Lucifer princeps tenebrarum profundi tristicie regens acherontis Dudum quidem christi vicarii sequentes eius vestigia
msItem.note: Helen Feng, 'Devil's Letters: Their History and Significance in Church and Society, 1100–1500' (PhD, Northwestern University, 1982), 450–455 (listing this ms.)

msItem.incipit: Primus quando aliquis verberat clericum et sunt multe excepciones
Primus est coytus cum moniali

msItem.rubric: Nota casus in quibus potest sibi dicere
msItem.incipit: Primus est in nocturno alius in notorio depopulliatore
msItem.rubric: Casus in quibus ecclesia consecrata debet reconsecrari
msItem.incipit: Nota quod tres sunt casus in quibus ecclesia consecrata debet reconsecrari. Primus si ecclesia combusta fuerit

msItem.note: Cf. Wiesbaden, Nassauischen Landesbibliothek, Hs. 25 fol. 339v; (in part) BnF, Latin 8931, fols. 256–257v.
Fol. 129v blank.

supportDesc.support: Fols. 1–31 paper and parchment mixed (the inner and outer bifolia of each quire are parchment); fols. 32–129 paper.

decoDesc.decoNote: Art. 1: 4–7 line red initials with simple silhouette decoration at the beginning of books.

msItem.note: A text which combines a vocabulary of civil law, the 'Epitome exactis regibus', with vocabularies of canon law. The resulting text is divided into 234 numbered sections, which form the basis of an alphabetical index. The same or a very similar compilation in Jena, MS. G. B. f. 18a fols. 29ra-72vb (prov. Erfurt, St Peter's).

msItem.incipit: Exactis a romana ciuitate regibus constitutei sunt consules duo
msItem.explicit: quod supervacuum est prouectis et tantum de isto
msItem.note: Here sections 1–170

msItem.rubric: Declaracio terminorum in rubricis primi libri decretalium
msItem.incipit: Constitucio est ius scriptum unius cause uel negocii. Consultacio est in qua
msItem.explicit: Priuilegium est beneficium contra ius commune institutum

msItem.note: Followed immediately by three other alphabetical vocabularies all presented as one continuous text:

msItem.incipit: (fol. 147ra) Ambicio est inordinatum desiderium honoris
(fol. 147vb) Aduersio est assumpcio cuius operis pro certa mercede
(fol. 150ra)A quandoque facit separacionem et quandoque includit
Annus naturalis est a quolibet die incipiens
msItem.explicit: de iudeis c. ult. Hic est finis.

msItem.note: Sections 171–234
Alphabetical index of terms
msItem.incipit:
206 A
52 ABigeus
106 Abolicio

msItem.colophon:
Et sic et finis sit laus et gloria
Detur pro pena scriptori pulchra puella
Si non est pulchra pacietur verbera dura

msItem.title: List of the archdioceses in Germany and the dioceses within them
msItem.note: Added in a different hand.

msItem.rubric: Repeticio doctoralis et vtilis valde ad studiose persoluendum horas canonicas illius rubrice De celebracione missarum in Clementinas [later hand]
msItem.incipit: In nomine domini amen. Ad honorem illius cuius opera sunt inseperabilia
(fol. 159va) Nota primo ex primo capitulo certum modum et ordine in diuinis officiis debere seruari
msItem.explicit: ad aliquas horas peculiares uel vigilias mortuorum obligatur
msItem.colophon: Et hec de horis canonicis anno .1421. in festo galli scripta
msItem.note: Pr. USTC 805942, vol. 15/2, fols. 558ra-559vb. Rest of fol. 165r blank; fol. 165v blank.

decoDesc.decoNote: Art. 1: 4–7 line red initials with simple silhouette decoration
Coloured red initial at the beginning of art 2.

title.supplied: Commentary on Adam of Aldersbach, Summula Raymundi

msItem.incipit: Circa summulam raymundi ponitur tale thema, Oportet illud monstrare iter eterne salutis. Hanc proposicionem scribit beatus gregorius
(fol. 167va) Queritur primo utrum utrum sacramenta sint septem in numero et arguitur quod non, tot sunt sacramenta quod sunt vasa gracie susceptiua

(fol. 168va) Utrum ius canonicum a lege et ewangelio institutum sit hic subiectum et arguitur primo quod non, illud quod subicitur in decretalibus et in decretis, hoc non est subiectum in hac sciencia

(fol. 169vb) Summula de Iste liber cuius subiectum est ius canonicum ewangelica tradicione a sanctis patribus confirmatum, prima sui diuisione diuiditur in partem prohemiale et executiuam, pars executiua est ibi, In summis festis. Prima pars diuiditur in tres partes. Primo reddit auditores benevolos ostendens unum esse fundamentum sui libri. Secundo reddit auditores dociles et attentos

(fol. 169vb) In summis festis ad Hic est pars executiua. In qua auctor determinat secundum ordinem de hiis que promisit in prologo, et diuiditur principaliter in quinque capitula principalia. In primo auctor determinat de hiis que pertinent ad officium misse et de quibusdam aliis sacramentis scilicet de corpore domenico uel eukaristia, de baptismo, et de uncione
(fol. 170vb) In defunctorum Hic autor docet modus seruandi collectos in missa defunctorum
msItem.note: The final lemmata are:
msItem.incipit: (fol. 260rb) O species lepre Hic exclamat contra peccatum sodomiticum et vtitur multis exclamacionibus in quibus detestatur hoc genus peccatorum
(fol. 260vb) Te infelix pudet Hic autor reprehendit illos qui pudent confiteri peccata sua, sepeliendo ea in corde suo
msItem.explicit: Est finis huius operibus in quibus si quid dixi quod videatur contrarium veritati in hoc petitorem subicio correccioni uestra si quid aliter sapitis hoc vobis dominus reuelauit etc.
msItem.colophon: Et sic est finis huius libri Anno domini M CCCCo xx primo In vigilia annucciacionis beate marie virginis. In lypczig.
msItem.note: Rest of fol. 261rb blank; fol. 261v blank.

decoDesc.decoNote: 10-line flourished initial in red and black at the beginning of art. 1; 6-line red initial with silhouette decoration, fol. 168vb

msItem.incipit: Distinctus est librum decretorum in tres partes. Prima vocatur distincciones eo quod distincta sit in particulas centum et vna, que particule vocatur distincciones
In primis xxti distinccionibus tractat gracianus de iure ponendo iuris diffiniciones diuisiones et subdiuisiones
msItem.explicit: Item anno domini MCCCmo xvj Clementine sunt promulgate etc.

msItem.incipit: Circa lecturam arboris consangwinitatis et affinitatis diuersi olym diuersi modum ponentibus uel tenentibus
msItem.explicit: et precipue studentes continue perseuerentes per graciam eius qui est benedictus in secula seculorum amen
msItem.note: Pr. GW 1692 etc. The 'arbor' on fols. 267v-268r.

msItem.incipit: Decimo ut promissi pro plena instruccione quantum ad nigra puncta arboris et per me apposita in supplementum quantum leuius potero subnecto
msItem.explicit: debeneficio femine. Hec de huiusmodi opuscule huius partis.
msItem.note: Also in Berlin, SB, Theol. lat. fol. 141 (Rose 534), fol 389v. Cf. Dessau, Stadtbibliothek, Georg Hs. 265. quart, attributed to Johannes Calderinus, but ending differently.

msItem.title: Repetitio de usuris
msItem.incipit: Nauiganti . Casus summarius. Usurarius est qui a debitore aliquid recipit ultra sortem et si suscepit in se periculum. [X 5.19.19] Nauiganti Exempli gratia ut hic ponitur. Et quia frequencius in talibus casibus illud solet contigere
Nundinas id est ad locum ubi sunt nundine uel mercimonia et conuentus publicus ad merces emendas
msItem.explicit: sed quia prima facie quicquid similatur usure propter hoc tamen non est usura etc finis

msItem.title: Verses on the ten plagues, ten commandments, ten trespasses; added, later hand

msItem.incipit: Ydola fecit homo dominum iuravit inique

msItem.note: Acknowledgement by Nicholaus Wilberg of the sale to the 'archipresbyter' of Wetzlar (Wesflariensi) of a Liber decretalium and a Speculum humanae salvationis in 1471

Fragment of a document mentioning 'Swalbach' (Schwalbach (Schöffengrund?)) perhaps relating to gifts to the parish church ('... dat ad fabricam et plebano ...'). Mistakenly described as a German-language document in the Summary Catalogue.

supportDesc.support: Paper. Watermark: bull's head with cross or perhaps trefoil above (indistinct), (?) type Piccard xi.51–147 (cf. 106–9?)

layoutDesc.layout: (fols. 262ra-270rb) 2 cols., scribe A c. 38–40 lines, scribe B c. 49 lines, column space 225–30 70–5
(fols. 270v-273v) 1 col., c. 47–9 lines, written above top line, ruled space 215 155

decoDesc.decoNote: 6-line red initial at the beginning of art. 2; elsewhere smaller red initials.

msItem.note: Document concerning a benefaction to the church of Uelzen ('Vltzen'); issued by 'Turibius episcopus Tudensis' [Tui-Vigo, Spain; occ. 1403, P. M. Baumgarten, Von der Apostolischen kanzlei (1908), 37] in the second year of his pontificate.
